column4: hello. what does it mean when a process is showing more thgan 100% cpu usage on "top" ? I thought 100% was the cpu usage limit.
ah I understand
how can I check how many cpus are working on that machine, mynous ?
ops it was Myrtti
you might want to use htop instead of top
what do you want to download?
and what is wrong with installing them the normal way?
how old?
7.04 feisty
right, thats because feisty is EOL
if you want packages you need to upgrade or use old-releases (really not recommended)
why can't you upgrade?
well its just going to get nastier the longer you leave it :). If you need them badly you can get them from old-releases
one sec
you need to replace the current repo's with the ones outlined in https://help.ubuntu.com/community/GutsyUpgrades. They will contain the postfix packages you need
also, production servers should not be running old, possibly unsecure apps :)
sendmail might be better, compared to a full MTA
yes. maybe
if you only need it to send you a mail when something fails thats a much better way then slapping in postfix
I will test that.. it probably has less dependencies as well
you need to upgrade
It's not possible on this production environment. Do I need to download them somewhere?
seriously, you need to upgrade :)
